            <string language="en">Where is the Covent Garden Market?</string>

        <educational>
          <learningResourceType>
            <source>LRE.learningResourceTypeValues</source>
            <value>lesson plan</value>
          </learningResourceType>
          <intendedEndUserRole>
            <source>LRE.intendedEndUserRoleValues</source>
            <value>teacher</value>
          </intendedEndUserRole>
          <typicalAgeRange>
            <string language="x-t-lre">12-12</string>
            <string language="en">12-12</string>
          </typicalAgeRange>
          <description>
            <string language="en">1.	Revision of the English names of places in a town and prepositions of place:
a)	speaking activity (a group work) — shop, swimming pool, restaurant, museum, school, market, supermarket, hotel, post office, park, bank, bus station, cinema, library, cafe, hospital, bookshop, pet shop, toy shop, shoe shop.
A teacher shows flashcards of different buildings and asks students to give their English names.
b)	speaking activity (a pair work) — next to, opposite, between
One of the students chooses a place on a map in the coursebook and describes where it is using prepositions of place. The second child should identify the place.
2.	Introducing structures connected with giving and following simple directions.
a)	speaking and writing activity (an individual work)  -
 turn left/right, don't turn left/right, go along, go straight on, stop
A teacher shows flashcards with various road signs and asks students, in their mother tongue, what instructions can be connected with these pictures. After identifying all of the signs, flashcards are put on the blackboard together with English instructions. A teacher points at particular sign, says an instruction and asks students to repeat it. At the end of this exercise students are given handouts with the signs – their task is to write down a correct instruction under each of the pictures.
b)	listening comprehension (an individual work) 
A teacher plays the recording for students to listen and do the actions. They should finish at the place they started from – sitting on their chair.
c)   speaking activity (an individual work) - 
How do I get …?/Where is ……?
A teacher writes on the blackboard two questions: How do I get ...? and Where is ... ? Students are encouraged to guess the meaning of these questions. Later on, they copy these questions to their notebooks.
d)   reading comprehension (a pair work) 
Students read a dialogue in their coursebooks and circle the correct answers, using the map to check details.
e)   speaking activity (a group work) 
Students take turns to ask each other for directions to a place on
the map.
3.	Feedback exercise (an individual work) — using learning resource (a game-like multimedia learning object):
A teacher tells students about two places in London: the British Museum and the Covent Garden Market. Students task is to get from the gate of the British Museum to the Covent Garden by following the directions that they are given. If they choose the wrong way, they will start from the beginning.
4.  Homework:
Students’ task is to do the exercises from the workbook — look at the signs and write the correct directions, look at a maze and put the instructions in the correct order, find two places on the map by following the directions, fill in the gaps in a dialog with the correct instructions. 
Additional activity – students’ task is to complete the crossword with the correct names of places.

Materials:
Compontents of the course:
Cathy Lawdy and Mark Hancock, Winners 2 – Student’s Book, Oxford University Press, 2007, p.34. 
Cathy Lawdy and Mark Hancock, Winners 2 – Workbook, Oxford University Press, 2007, p.28.
Cathy Lawdy and Mark Hancock, Winners 2 –CD, Oxford University Press, 2007, recording 45.

Flashcards of different places in a town: 
http://www.eslflashcards.com/preview.php?id=16
http://www.eslflashcards.com/preview.php?id=17

Flashcards and handouts with road signs which come from:
http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Road_signs_of_Poland

Learning resource:
A game-like multimedia learning object— "Virtual walk in London": 
http://resources.eun.org/demoportal/virtual_walk_london_eng.zip

Handout with additional homework:
http://bogglesworldesl.com/files/placesi.jpg
</string>
          </description>
        </educational>
